**Facing the Truth**

A dimly lit room, Raskolnikov looks troubled.  
“Why, is it the bourgeois disgrace you fear?”  

Raskolnikov: “Ach, hang it!”  
(whispers) “I don’t want to say more.”  

---

Raskolnikov sits in despair, grappling with thoughts.  
“Hang it! You’ve lost faith in yourself.”  

Speaker: “You’re not hopelessly base!”  
“Find faith, and you will live.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is urged to confess and embrace suffering as a path to finding faith and meaning in life.
